purpleculture_pinyin:
shǎn
to dodge; to duck out of the way; to beat it; shaken (by a fall); to sprain; to pull a muscle; lightning; spark; a flash; to flash (across one's mind); to leave behind; (Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine; to dodge; to duck out of the way; to beat it; shaken (by a fall); to sprain; to pull a muscle; lightning; spark; a flash; to flash (across one's mind); to leave behind; (Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
увернуться; уклоняться с дороги; победить его; потрясен (при падении); растянуть; потянуть мышцу; молния; Искра; Вспышка; вспыхивать (в уме); оставить позади; (Интернет-сленг) (проявление привязанности) «ослепительно» сахаристый; увернуться; уклоняться с дороги; победить его; потрясен (при падении); растянуть; потянуть мышцу; молния; Искра; Вспышка; вспыхивать (в уме); оставить позади; (Интернет-сленг) (демонстрации привязанности) «ослепительно» сахаристый

heisig_chinese_memo: You want to see what's behind the gates but can only see little flashes of people walking by. &nbsp
Ru_Words:
閃くひらめく
  • сверкнуть, блеснуть, вспыхнуть (о молнии), обр. мелькнуть (в уме)
    • 閃光せんこう
  • вспышка
    • warodai
    一閃いっせん
  • вспышка
    • warodai
    閃光器せんこうき
  • лампа-вспышка, импульсный источник света, аппарат, дающий мигающий (вспыхивающий) свет
    • warodai
    閃々たるせんせんたる
  • кн. сверкающий, искрящийся, блещущий, блестящий
    • warodai
Ru_trainchinese:
shǎn: (глаг) сверкнуть, мелькнуть; увернуться, скрыться, отскочить; вывихнуть, растянуть (часть тела); (диал.) оставить, бросить
shǎn: (сущ/глаг) молния; сверкать, отливать; нагрянуть
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (人) hides under the gate (門) from the flash of lightning
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Those people that guard the Buckingham Palace gates don't move unless you touch them, in which case they can have you on the ground in a flash.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " people " to " door ", the original meaning is to peek through the door. "Shuowen": "Flash, peep into the door. From the person in the door." Such as "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "Biography of Liang Xi" Pei Songzhi quoted "Wei Lue. "The Biography of Causal Officials": "(Liu Lei) is born and believes little. Every time a large official comes out, the small official will follow him to check it out. The white will spy on the wall and watch the Cao at night."

" Flashing " means flickering or appearing suddenly. For example, in Tang Dynasty Li Yong's "Duck Fu": "Suddenly startled and flickered in the pond, floating and sinking and flickering." Chapter 7 of The Romance of the Three Kingdoms: "Yuan Shao should come first, less than five miles away, only the shouts from behind the mountain There is a big crowd, and the first three generals are Liu Xuande, Guan Yunchang, and Zhang Yide."

" Flash " means to escape, escape. For example, Mei Yaochen of the Song Dynasty "Yi Yun and Sun Yao Yandang": "Thousand Renzhu's sky is flashing, Wangong's brush is light and thick." "Journey to the West" Chapter 17: "He walked lightly, flashing on the stone Under the cliff, watch in secret."

" Flash " means abandon, leave. For example, the second fold of Ma Zhiyuan’s "Tears in Qingshan Tears" in the Yuan Dynasty: "Flash down me, a young girl." Chapter 6 of "Jin Ping Mei Ci Hua": "How can a grieving thief take care of the slave, and then go to that house to add another sweetheart That's it."

" Flash " means sprain. For example, the second fold of the fourth book of "The Story of the West Chamber" by Wang Shifu of the Yuan Dynasty: "Madam stopped flashing her hand, and stopped her anger, listening to the matchmaker." Chapter 102 of "Water Margin": "He saw something on the bench and kicked it. Waist ribs. When I came here, I was panting."

" Flash " means frustration. Such as the Ming Dynasty Ling Mengchu's "Er Mo Pai An Surprise. Volume 20: "The merchant has lost almost ten thousand dollars after eating this flash, and family affairs have since disappeared." It also refers to accidents and mistakes. For example, the fifth chapter of "The Heroes of Sons and Daughters" in Wenkang of the Qing Dynasty: "In case of a mishap, my store can't make it clean!"

" Flash " also means harm and injury. For example, Chapter 11 of "Water Margin": "Who would want to be trapped by the thief Gao Qi today? I wrote the face and sent it straight to this place. The flash made me have a hard time running home, a country difficult to vote, and suffer from this loneliness. !"
humanum_short_description_en: From " people " to " door ", the original meaning is to peek through the door.
humanum_full_description:
從「人」從「門」，本義是從門中偷看。《說文》：「閃，闚頭門中也。从人在門中。」如《三國志．魏書．梁習傳》裴松之注引《魏略．苛吏傳》：「（劉類）生又少信，每遺大吏出，輒使小吏隨覆察之，白日常自於牆壁間闚閃，夜使幹廉察諸曹。」

　　「閃」表示忽隱忽現或突然出現。如唐代李邕〈鬭鴨賦〉：「忽驚迸以差池，倏浮沈而閃爍。」《三國演義》第7回：「袁紹當先趕來，不到五里，只聽得山背後喊聲大起，閃出一彪人馬，為首三員大將，乃是劉玄德，關雲長，張翼德。」

　　「閃」表示躲避、逃避。如宋代梅堯臣〈依韻和孫侔鴈蕩〉：「千仞柱天何斂閃，萬工揮筆漫輕濃。」《西遊記》第17回：「他卻輕步潛踪，閃在那石崖之下，偷睛觀看。」

　　「閃」表示拋棄、丟下。如元代馬致遠《青衫淚》第二折：「閃下我，女少年。」《金瓶梅詞話》第6回：「負心的賊，如何撇閃了奴，又往那家另續上心甜的兒了。」

　　「閃」表示扭傷。如元代王實甫《西廂記》第四本第二折：「夫人休閃了手，且息怒停嗔，聽紅娘說。」《水滸全傳》第102回：「他見甚麼板凳作怪，踢閃了腰肋。適纔走來，說話也是氣喘。」

　　「閃」表示挫折。如明代凌蒙初《二刻拍案驚奇．卷二十》：「商家吃這一閃，差不多失了萬金東西，家事自此消乏了。」又指意外、差錯。如清代文康《兒女英雄傳》第5回：「萬一有個失閃 ，我店家推不上乾淨兒來！」

　　「閃」還表示害、傷害。如《水滸全傳》第11回：「誰想今日被高俅這賊坑陷了我這一場，文了面，直斷送到這里。閃得我有家難奔，有國難投，受此寂寞！」
humanum_short_description: 從「人」從「門」，本義是從門中偷看。

HSK 5: 闪,閃

Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: A man 人 just glimpsed through a door 門
  • ⿵ Surround from above
    • 門 [ mén ] gate, door, entrance, opening
    • 人 [ rén ] man, person; people
①天空的電光：閃電。打閃。
②突然顯現：閃光。閃爍。閃耀。閃現。
③側轉體躲避：躲閃。閃讓。
④因動作過猛，使一部分筋肉受傷而疼痛：閃了腰。
⑤姓氏。

(Simplified: 闪)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: A man 人 just glimpsed through a door 門
HSK: 5
Freq: 7289
Kanshudo mnemonic:the man (人) hides under the gate (門) from the flash of lightning
Chinese: You want to see what's behind the gates but can only see little flashes of people walking by.  
Meaning: flash
Hanzi: 闪
Story: Those people that guard the Buckingham Palace gates don't move unless you touch them, in which case they can have you on the ground in a flash.
Kind: traditional

從「 人 」從「 門 」，本義是從門中偷看。《說文》：「閃，闚頭門中也。从人在門中。」如《三國志．魏書．梁習傳》裴松之注引《魏略．苛吏傳》：「（劉類）生又少信，每遺大吏出，輒使小吏隨覆察之，白日常自於牆壁間闚閃，夜使幹廉察諸曹。」 「 閃 」表示忽隱忽現或突然出現。如唐代李邕〈鬭鴨賦〉：「忽驚迸以差池，倏浮沈而閃爍。」《三國演義》第7回：「袁紹當先趕來，不到五里，只聽得山背後喊聲大起，閃出一彪人馬，為首三員大將，乃是劉玄德，關雲長，張翼德。」 「 閃 」表示躲避、逃避。如宋代梅堯臣〈依韻和孫侔鴈蕩〉：「千仞柱天何斂閃，萬工揮筆漫輕濃。」《西遊記》第17回：「他卻輕步潛踪，閃在那石崖之下，偷睛觀看。」 「 閃 」表示拋棄、丟下。如元代馬致遠《青衫淚》第二折：「閃下我，女少年。」《金瓶梅詞話》第6回：「負心的賊，如何撇閃了奴，又往那家另續上心甜的兒了。」 「 閃 」表示扭傷。如元代王實甫《西廂記》第四本第二折：「夫人休閃了手，且息怒停嗔，聽紅娘說。」《水滸全傳》第102回：「他見甚麼板凳作怪，踢閃了腰肋。適纔走來，說話也是氣喘。」 「 閃 」表示挫折。如明代凌蒙初《二刻拍案驚奇．卷二十》：「商家吃這一閃，差不多失了萬金東西，家事自此消乏了。」又指意外、差錯。如清代文康《兒女英雄傳》第5回：「萬一有個失閃 ，我店家推不上乾淨兒來！」 「 閃 」還表示害、傷害。如《水滸全傳》第11回：「誰想今日被高俅這賊坑陷了我這一場，文了面，直斷送到這里。閃得我有家難奔，有國難投，受此寂寞！」

閃字的基本解释

閃
shǎn
见“闪”。

閃字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shǎn］
［《廣韻》失冉切，上琰，書。］
［《廣韻》舒贍切，去豔，書。］
“闪1”的繁体字。
(1)从门内偷看。
(2)忽隐忽现；突然显现。
(3)躲避；避让。
(4)因颠仆、侧转或用力过猛而扭伤筋络。
(5)害，使受损害。
(6)挫折。
(7)遮拦。
(8)指为风寒所袭。
(9)欺哄、蒙骗。
(10)招引。
(11)抛，丢失。
(12)指抛撇。
(13)闪电。
(14)闪耀；光亮忽隐忽现。
(15)指眼睛张开。亦指眼睛开合闪动。
(16)动摇不定；晃动。
(17)姓。明有闪镗、闪继迪。

閃字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【門字部】　閃； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页1330第06
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?失冉切，音㴸。【說文】闚頭門中也。从人，在門中。會意。【廣韻】出門貌。　又【增韻】嚲避也。【禮·禮運·龍以爲畜故魚鮪不淰註】淰之言閃也。【釋文】閃，失冉反。　又暫見也。【木華·海賦】蝄像暫曉而閃屍。【註】音式染反，閃屍，暫見貌。　又【正字通】動貌。古詩：寒鴉閃閃前山去。杜甫詩：閃閃浪花翻。俗作㴸。　又姓。明永樂中，永州判閃靄。　又傾佞貌。【後漢·趙壹傳】榮納由於閃楡，孰知辨其蚩姸。【註】閃楡，傾佞貌。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?舒贍切，音掞。又【集韻】式劒切，音?。又子豔切，音?。義?同。

閃字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
閃字的起名意思

暂无。

flash
Basic explanation of words
flash
shǎn
See "Flash".
flash
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shǎn］
["Guangyun" lost and cut, Shangyan, book. ]
["Guang Yun" Shu Yan cut, go to Yan, book. ]
"Flash 1" in traditional characters.
(1) Peek from inside the door.
(2) Flickering and appearing; appearing suddenly.
(3) Avoid; avoid.
(4) The muscles are sprained due to stumbling, turning on the side, or excessive force.
(5) Harm, cause damage.
(6) Frustration.
(7) Blocking.
(8) Refers to being struck by wind and cold.
(9) Deceive and deceive.
(10) Attract.
(11) Throw, lose.
(12) Refers to throwing away.
(13) Lightning.
(14) Shine; light flickers and flickers.
(15) Means that the eyes are open. Also refers to the eye opening and closing flashing.
(16) Unsteady; shaking.
(17) Last name. Obviously there are flash boring and flash jidi.
